dict.acceptation: 完美地；理想地；完全地；无瑕疵地；

sent.orig: She performed perfectly on the balance beam; spoke English perfectly; solved the problem perfectly.
sent.trans: 她在平衡木上表现得很完美；很好地说英语；完美地解决了这个问题。

sent.orig: You are perfectly lovable and perfectly loved.
sent.trans: 你是如此的可爱，并且完美地被爱著。

sent.orig: You can't get around the fact that the price was perfectly fair, perfectly reasonable.
sent.trans: 你回避不了这样一个事实，即价钱十分公道的，合情合理的。

sent.orig: He drew his chair forward; he pushed it back; he looked perfectly incensed, and perfectly helpless.
sent.trans: 他一会儿把坐椅向前挪，一会儿又把坐椅往后推，他显得火冒三丈，也显得束手无策。

sent.orig: For example, moral perfection is thought to entail being both perfectly merciful and perfectly just.
sent.trans: 例如，道德的完美被认为必要两个都是非常仁慈的并且完美地就。
